key_symptoms: Fever, lacrimation, nasal discharge, and hypersalivation
Well-circumscribed, round, slightly raised, firm, and painful skin nodules
Nodules may develop on the muzzle and within the nasal and buccal mucous membranes
Regional lymph nodes are swollen, and edema develops in the udder, brisket, and legs
lumpy_skin_disease.action_required: Administration of antibiotics to control secondary infection and good nursing care are recommended. Vaccination with attenuated virus offers the most promising method of control.

key_symptoms: Circular, hairless patches with gray-white crusts
Lesions commonly occur on the head and neck
Mild inflammation and itching may be present
In severe cases, multiple lesions can coalesce
ringworm.action_required: Topical antifungal treatments are commonly used. In more severe cases, systemic antifungal therapy may be necessary. Environmental decontamination is crucial to prevent reinfection.

key_symptoms: Redness, swelling, and pain in unpigmented skin areas
Crusting, scaling, and ulceration of affected skin
Lesions typically occur on areas exposed to sunlight (ears, face, back)
photosensitization.action_required: Remove animals from sunlight immediately. Identify and eliminate the causative agent (plants, drugs, or liver dysfunction). Provide supportive care including anti-inflammatory drugs and wound management.
